name: forestland_ownership3_WTL1
description: This data publication contains 250 meter raster data depicting the spatial distribution of forest ownership types in the conterminous United States. The data are a modeled representation of forest land by ownership type, and include three types of public ownership: federal, state, and local; three types of private: family (includes individuals and families), corporate, and other private (includes conservation and natural resource organizations, and unincorporated partnerships and associations); as well as Native American tribal lands. The most up-to-date data available were used in creating this data publication. A plurality of the ownership data were from 2014, but some data were as old as 2004.

The most up-to-date data available were used in creating this data publication. A plurality of the ownership data were from 2014, but some data were as old as 2004.

documentInfo.title: forestland_ownership3_WTL1
documentInfo.author: usf_alvarez
documentInfo.subject: Map shows forests and woodland ownerships in the United States in 2014. Ownerships include: federal, state, county and municipalities, private corporate and private noncorporate.
documentInfo.keywords: Forest ownership, private corporate forest, private noncorporate forest, private forest, public forest, federal forestland, state forestland, county forestland, ArcGIS, Service Definition, .sd
documentInfo.credits: Funding for this project provided by USDA Forest Service, Northern Research Station (NRS), Forest Inventory & Analysis as well as USDA Forest Service, State and Private Forestry Cooperative Forestry.
documentInfo.Title: Forest ownership in the conterminous United States circa 2014: distribution of seven ownership types - geospatial dataset
documentInfo.Comments: This data publication contains 250 meter raster data depicting the spatial distribution of forest ownership types in the conterminous United States. The data are a modeled representation of forest land by ownership type, and include three types of public ownership: federal, state, and local; three types of private: family (includes individuals and families), corporate, and other private (includes conservation and natural resource organizations, and unincorporated partnerships and associations); as well as Native American tribal lands. The most up-to-date data available were used in creating this data publication. A plurality of the ownership data were from 2014, but some data were as old as 2004.
documentInfo.Subject: These data are designed for strategic analyses at a national or regional scale which require spatially explicit information regarding the extent, distribution, and prevalence of the ownership types represented. These data are not recommended for tactical analyses on a sub-regional scale, or for informing local management decisions. Furthermore, map accuracies vary considerably and thus the utility of these data can vary geographically under different ownership patterns.
